storyInfo: An accident during a field mission has Meteor recalling the impossible choices she was once faced with.

attributes.content: Good hustle these past few days, everybody. Let's break a bit early today—we're still twenty-five klicks out from the objective. If we make good time tomorrow morning, I think we'll get there by the afternoon.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Thanks, Meteor. I thought we'd be gnawing on rations in the field. I didn't expect we'd get proper hot meals.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Yeah, never knew you were such a good cook.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: So what's stewing today? It smells great, I caught a whiff of it while I was pegging the tents.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: It's a hometown specialty.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: A secret family recipe?
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Nah, I lost my parents when I was very young. It was a village household by the mountains that helped me grow. They're all good and kind people.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: This soup is something they taught me. It's simple to make, and good for cooking out in the wilds.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Ah... sorry I brought it up.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: What's to be sorry for? It's alright.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Oh, it smells amazing. Can I ask for the recipe?
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Of course. It's not complicated.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: You need spinach roots and wild gingerflax I just took the chance to dig up, the striped scalecis we caught this afternoon, and I used some pickled jerky and salt I brought along to season, then let it stew for fifteen minutes. Then you're good to go.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: So this is what everyone meant when they said we wouldn't regret going with you.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Hardly, I just know a few simple country dishes. I could never compare to a chef like Matterhorn.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Phew. Though, if I could, adding a pinch of staricitron seeds would've made it even better. There's a little spicy kick to them. Drinking some hot meat soup peppered with them can really brush the cold away on days like these.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Staricitron...? It rings a bell, I've heard of a rare tree with the same name. I think it's a wood that a lot of nobles love for furniture.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Ah, and I remember it's a species unique to Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, your home is in Kazimierz. If you've seen them before, why not tell us a little about them.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Right, we really want to know more about where you came from.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Meteor? Meteor, why are you so quiet?
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Hm?! Ah, my home...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I've been away for so long. Just what were they like...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: It's not coming to me straight away.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Aw, that's a shame—hey! What are you hitting me for?
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Eat up, kiddo, or you won't grow any taller.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Do you see this, Meteor?!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Alright, alright, it's getting late. Pour another bowl. I brought some of Matterhorn's crackers too. You can all share them.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Wow, that's incredible! Thanks, Meteor.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Turn in as soon as you're done. I'm a little tired. I'll be going to sleep first.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Where am I? It's so dark.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, Meteor.
Who is it?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Come quick, Meteor. I've been waiting for you forever.
Who are you?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, come with me. There's going to be a moonshadow in the sky tonight. We can climb the staricitron tree and see the twin moons.
Lana? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I've been waiting for you here all this time.
Listen. The wind passing through the damp leaves. It's been pushing me on.
Wind? There's no wind here, Lana. Come here, quick. Don't leave this place.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I'm going, Meteor. Quick, follow me...
Come back, Lana! Where are you going?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Come quick, Meteor. You know I'm waiting for you.
She's... gone.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor! Meteor!
Um... Uncle, why are you here...?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: No, never mind. That's right, have you seen Lana? She just came by, and I don't know where she ran off to.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: You're mixed up. Lana's been sick for a month now. How's she going outside?
She's sick?! But just now, I swear she was... this is strange... um, how is she, then? Is she any better?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: *Sigh* Not much to cheer for. Barely gets her porridge down her in the morning, and she sicks up half a bowl of pink.
How could that be! What about a doctor, then, Uncle? Has a doctor seen her?!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, it's... why I came to see you today. We've got no real options left now. This winter's gone on too long, autumn was too short. Not a thing left over.
Whole host of the village children are already beyond sickly. If we can't get any more medicine for Lana, she won't be able to make it through the winter.
I still have a bit of savings! I'll give you all of—
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: ...Meteor, it's not enough... there's a man who passed by and said, he wants some staricitron wood. He gets the timber, he'll leave us some money and supplies. We can pull through the winter with those.
Does he have to have those staricitron trees? Countless generations of my family's looked after that forest.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What about other trees, will other trees do? I'm begging you. Just wait a little longer, and we might have some other way. We will...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: No, Meteor, we... don't. We love them just as much as you do, but...
Help me, Meteor—*cough* *cough*—we've got no other way.
attributes.name: Sorrowful Voice

attributes.content: Meteor, save me!
attributes.name: Immature Voice

attributes.content: Meteor—save an old girl!
attributes.name: Wizened Voice

attributes.content: Meteor, Meteor!
attributes.name: Anxious Voice

attributes.content: Ah—ahh, ahh! I'll save you all, I will—*huff* *huff*—*urk*—
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, what's wrong? It was a nightmare, wasn't it? It's okay, it's okay, we're all here.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: We are. Meteor, want some water? I'll pour you a cup.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Haagh—it's you. I thought...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: The pressure of the rescue mission probably got too much. Here, Meteor, wipe that sweat off.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: It's alright. Thank you both. My nerves must be taut, running all this way for days. I'm a little worn out.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, if you want to tell us anything, feel free. We'll help however we can.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: It really is alright. We all still need to be on our way. Let's get our things packed and go. I'll be fine.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: (Shaking head) Leave it, Keira. Don't ask.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Ah Fêng, how far are we from the objective?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Not far now. Less than three kilometers left—
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Oh, crap. Meteor, look. In the direction of the objective.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: That's intensely thick smoke. The report didn't mention anything about a fire.
attributes.name: Field Operator B

attributes.content: Keira, go look for survivors in the neighboring villages, and band them together to put the fire out! Ah Fêng, get the medicals ready! People have to be hurt with a fire this big! Quick!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: On it. Meteor, what about you?
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: I'll look closer to the scene, and see if I can find any other survivors!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: You be careful, then, Meteor!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: I will! Keep yourselves safe too!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (The fire's burning too intensely. I can't tell if there's still anyone inside.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Is anyone there? If you can hear me, please answer me! Is anyone there!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Is anyone there? If you can hear me, please answer me! Is anyone there!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Is-Is that you, Meteor? Get away!
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: What's going on? Uncle, I just heard a massive explosion come from here, and I ran right over.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Run, quick! Don't come near. Those tree-felling Originium engines the knight-lord brought in exploded. There's Originium dust scattered all over here.
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: Uncle, just save your voice for now. I'll bind the wound for you. Who else is here?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: No, no, you listen to me, Meteor. Get away, quick. You don't go, you won't make it. Those machines might explode again at any time. You... you'll catch ill! Quick, get away from here!
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: Uncle, I—I can't leave you all behind. Hang in there. I'll bring you out now.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Argh! My eyes—it hurts!
attributes.name: Wounded Villager

attributes.content: My leg! My leg's gone! Urgh—save me, save my soul!
attributes.name: Howling Villager

attributes.content: (What do I do, what do I do, what do I do? Dammit, what should I be doing?!)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What are you still gazing off for? Get out of here. It's dangerous!
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: Huh—?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*—my throat... ghaagh—*cough* *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (The back of my hand's... bloody. Did I cut it?)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Uncle! Uncle, are you still alright? Un... cle... are you all...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Answer me! Agh—*cough* *cough*—answer me... *urk*.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Me... teor... come here...
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: Oh, Uncle! Go on, I'm listening!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: We're—*cough* *cough*... all so sorry for you... but Lana... she asked you...
attributes.name: Collapsed Villager

attributes.content: Uncle! Uncle!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: How could this happen?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: How is everything I do wrong? How is everything I do useless...?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: How...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: By all rights, her face should be scorched dry by the blistering air, yet Meteor feels wet droplets, rolling down.
(Rubs back of hand against cheek)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Ugh—dammit, I can't believe I'm remembering that at a time like this.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Ohhhh, my child...
(What's that noise? Is there someone crying?)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Ohhh, my child! You wretch, why save me? You should've left me to die, how could you not save our child?!
attributes.name: Mournful Woman

attributes.content: Darling, it's my fault, I couldn't save our girl... ohh, my precious baby, Daddy's so sorry... *sobbing*
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: Why are you still here? Get out of here, quick!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Go? How? We can't go a step more. Our whole lives are ruined here... ohhh...
attributes.name: Mournful Woman

attributes.content: Miss. My leg's hurt. I can't walk. Get my wife out of here, forget about me. Quick, move!
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: I'm not going—*sobbing*—We're together as a family, and we'll die as a family. Ohhh, my child.
attributes.name: Mournful Woman

attributes.content: What's happening? Is there still someone inside?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Yes—*sobbing*—my girl's still in there. We were in a rush, and I—I was only in time to rescue my wife, and I left—the disgrace I am, I left my child in there... *sobbing*
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: Okay, sir. Save your breath. Do you still remember which part of the house your child was in?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: You won't be time—the fire's too big. Get my wife out of here. It's all hopeless.
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: (Grasps the man's collar) Where is she?!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: In her bedroom—s—southmost part of the attic.
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: Got it. Look after your lady.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Watch out—
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Mournful Woman

attributes.content: Darling? Darling, what's wrong? Someone, anyone! Save her!
attributes.name: Anguished Man

attributes.content: (It's all burning too fast. My eyes hurt so much.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Little girl, can you hear me? *cough* *cough* *cough*....
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (South of the attic... oh, there!)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Agh, hot—*cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Can only kick it open.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (I can't see anything clear. Dammit, all this thick smoke.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Is anyone there? *cough* *cough*—
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Save... help me...
(That voice came from the wardrobe!)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I've found you. Oh, thank goodness.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Daddy... mo...
attributes.name: Semiconscious Girl

attributes.content: She's losing consciousness already. Hold on, I'll take you away from here.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Lifts up the girl)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Only when Meteor looks back does she realize the way she came has now been engulfed by the inferno.

The scarlet blaze trails along the walls, stairs and doorframe as it spreads, the searing licks roiling and twisting without end, attempting to charge for the two in the room, lapping at their clothes and skin.
(Agh, now what do I do?!)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Dammit—it's collapsing!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* *cough*—*hiss*, *huff*—
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (I think my back got struck. It hurts. Right, the child!)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Phew... wonderful, she's alright. No, I need to think of a way to get out fast, I need to get up.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Argh, it really does hurt.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: H-Help... me...
attributes.name: Semiconscious Girl

attributes.content: I'll help you, I'll help you, I absolutely will.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Looks all around)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (There's a gap there. I think I can climb through. It should be from when the wall fell in the collapse just now.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (This hole is too small, I can't make it in. I can only get the child through first.)
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, are you there?! *cough* *cough* *cough* Where are you?
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Keira!!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Is that Keira?! I'm in here, I'm in here! South, there's a small hole here!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor! Ah, I see you! How'll we get through a hole this small? What now? *whimper*
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Don't cry, don't mind me for now. The child, get the child away!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Grab onto the child, careful of any splinters.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What about you then, Meteor?! I'll go find Fêng, you wait for me, hold on—
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Listen, forget about me, you won't make it. Get the child away quick. Go.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, no, I can't do that, I'll find some way. We can definitely make it back together. Eargh—
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Eek—no, it's too heavy, Keira, we can't push it apart!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: We'll try again! Hold onto my hand, and don't let go, Meteor!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Quickly, go! Or else you'll be in danger too!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Damn it all, get the child out of here!!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor!!!!
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Meteor...
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: Lana... I've been waiting for so long...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: I couldn't save you, and I couldn't save everyone. In the end... I couldn't protect a single thing...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: No, you've already done so well. It's enough, now... it's enough.
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: Were you waiting for me to go with you?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: No. I came to say goodbye.
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: Goodbye?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: (Hugging) I'm leaving, Meteor. Don't come with me.
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: You're going, in the end?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Yes. Don't cry. You're the bravest little hunter. You've still got such a long road to walk, and still so many people who need you.
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: I miss you, so much. I really do.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I miss you too, but it's time now. Go on, let me go.
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: See you...
attributes.name: Lana

attributes.content: Meteor, you're awake. How do you feel?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Mi...
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Making it out alive with injuries as serious as that, it's nothing short of a miracle.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: You'd better not pull this next time, heading on missions without any regard for your own safety. Both me and Gianna were worried sick about you.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Pfffheh.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Agh! That hurts.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What are you laughing about?! You've got burns all over your back, your windpipe's burnt, you have a fracture in your spinal column... do you want me to keep tallying for you?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I thought... you'd be crying your... eyes out over me—*cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What, is that the kind of person I am to you?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Oof... *huff*. Sorry, Mina, for causing you and all of the Medical such hassle.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: What are you being guilty for? We're just doing our jobs.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Hfff—Well, I'm sorry, but I'm powerless to promise you that.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Medical gave everything they had to pull you from the cold hands of death this time, but IF there's a next time, we'll all be powerless to promise anything.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I... couldn't just look on as it all happened. I... don't ever want to see people stuck in those circumstances again, truly.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Between a rock and a hard place.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Not one person should ever be forced to make such a choice, forced to part, forced through... loss.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I can't do it, it's just... I can't.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, are you still brooding on the past?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I knew it, I can't hide anything from you.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: At the time, I believed if I just sacrificed the forest I always protected, I'd get to have Lana back, have everyone in the village living peacefully again.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: But fate really was too voracious. What it wanted wasn't just my concession.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I gave it an inch, and it wanted a mile, until it stripped my pockets bare of anything left.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: We've chatted about this before. Holding onto the past without letting go doesn't solve anything.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: You're right. And it's not like I don't understand.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: After Lana passed from illness, I took up her bow, and left the forest together with the other Oripathy sufferers.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: In those days wandering, I spent ages in a muddle. I hated that noble who refused to shoulder any blame, and left with nothing but a pat on the buttocks.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: And I hated myself, powerless to protect my loved ones, the things I cherished.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: But when I first met you, you were nothing like that. What happened?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I suppose I saw more, and my outlook changed.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: The people who once went with me walked, scattered, and I was left alone aimlessly drifting.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I only gradually came to realize, there's so many people across this land who've been through the same things I have, who all struggled painfully through such desperate dilemmas.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Having personally experienced that stress, how could I just stand and watch as others go through the same torture? That's why I'm willing and ready, regardless of the danger.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Because those smiles, lost then found again, make me feel like my heart is filled full once more.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Seeing as... this is how you think, I don't have much more I can say. While you've been unconscious these past few days, Gianna's been watching your bedside the whole time. You remember to give her a proper thanks.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I've got matters to attend to, so I'll be heading off now. Rest up well.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Gianna, Meteor just woke up. When we see her in a moment, make sure you don't throw yourself on her.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: I know, Keira. I folded Meteor a whole vase of roses, and on every single one I wrote a well wishing thing. If she has this, she'll get better real soon.
attributes.name: Gianna

attributes.content: (Smiles and shakes head) This little rascal.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Meteor, I heard from Mina you were awake. How are you?
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: Meteor, you... you... waaahh—you're finally awake! I was so scared!
attributes.name: Gianna

attributes.content: Gianna, don't cry. I'll be all better before you know it.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: ...Um, this vase is for you.
attributes.name: Gianna

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Don't ask, Gianna spent ages folding it. While you were out, Mina caught the little mite awake at night over and over, just folding roses.
attributes.name: Field Operator A

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Gianna, for making you worry.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: I don't want you to be sorry. Can you promise me you won't get hurt anymore? I get really scared I won't see you again.
attributes.name: Gianna

attributes.content: I won't, Gianna, I won't.
attributes.name: Meteor

attributes.content: Waaahhhh, Meteooor!!!
attributes.name: Gianna

attributes.content: Gianna, stop crying!
attributes.name: Field Operator A
